greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) gives the number of ballot sequences of length n having k largest parts, n >= k >= 0.
comment: Also number of standard Young tableaux with last row of length k.
link: Joerg Arndt and Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..60, flattened
example: The T(6,2)=14 ballot sequences of length 6 with 2 maximal elements are (dots for zeros):
The T(8,4)=14 such ballot sequences of length 8 and 4 maximal elements are:
These are the (reversed) Dyck words of semi-length 4.
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; `if`(n<1, x^l[-1],
h:= proc(l) local n; n:=nops(l); add(i, i=l)!/mul(mul(1+l[i]-j+
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..n))(g(n, n, [])):
mathematica: b[n_, l_List] :=  b[n, l] = If[n<1, x^l[[-1]], b[n-1, Append[l, 1]] +  Sum[If[i == 1 || l[[i-1]] > l[[i]], b[n-1, ReplacePart[l, i -> l[[i]] + 1]], 0], {i, 1, Length[l]}]]; T[n_] := If[n == 0, 1, Function[{p}, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, n}]][b[n-1, {1}]]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 07 2015, translated from Maple *)
program: (PARI) (A238123(n,k)=if(k, vecsum(apply(p->n!/Hook(Vecrev(p)), select(p->p[1]==k,partitions(n,[k,n])))), !n)); Hook(P,h=vector(P[1]),L=P[#P])={prod(i=1, L, h[i]=L-i+1)*prod(i=1,#P-1, my(D=-L+L=P[#P-i]); prod(k=0,L-1,h[L-k]+=min(k,D)+1))} \\  _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 03 2018
xref: The terms T(2*n,n) are the Catalan numbers (A000108).
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_ and _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 21 2014
